step.name: HowToUseWorkflow
step.title: How to use this workflow
step.description:
To use this workflow, note the following:
  • Take ownership! Make sure that you have ownership of workflow steps that you want to perform, and assign other steps to the appropriate users, using the Assignment and Ownership action in the Workflow Steps table. Taking ownership is important, because without it you will not see the Perform tab, which contains the meat of the instructions for each step.

    If you're the owner of the workflow, you can take ownership of all steps. If you were assigned one or more steps by the owner, you can take ownership of those steps.

    Do the following:

    • From the table listing the steps for the workflow (the Workflow Steps table), select the step or steps to be owned by you. This action is disabled if the step is not assigned to you.
    • Click Actions, then select Assignment and Ownership > Take Ownership. The Take Ownership window is displayed. This page includes the Selected Steps table. You can expand this section to review the steps for which this action applies.
    • Optionally, enter a comment in the Comments field to document this action.
    • Click OK to complete the transfer of step ownership to yourself.

  • Expand all steps for ease of navigation: You might find it easier to navigate through all the steps in the workflow if you expand the view so that all the sub-steps show as follows:
    1. Click Actions, then select Select All.
    2. Click Actions, then select Expand.
  • Track your progress: When you have performed the work of a step, click the Finish box below the instructions to track your progress through the workflow. This also takes you back out to the list of steps for the workflow so that you are ready to go on to the next one.
    • Substeps: To navigate to the substeps contained within a step, click on the workflow title of the workflow at the top of the screen. Although the sub-steps are listed below the step, you cannot navigate to the sub-steps from within a step.

    Note that a step containing substeps does not include a Perform tab.
step.instructions: Congratulations! If you can read this, you have successfully taken ownership of this workflow step!

ul.li: You must have a contract with IBM for a Container Pricing for IBM Z solution.
You should have an existing Workload Manager service definition that you will modify for Container Pricing.
The person performing the Workload Manager steps should be familiar with Workload Manager service definitions.
The person performing the Sub Capacity Reporting Tool (SCRT) steps should be familiar with SCRT.

description.p: You will modify the service definition to do the following. Add a tenant resource group and a tenant report class. Tenant resource groups and tenant report classes support mapping workloads directly to Container Pricing for IBM Z. For information about tenant resource groups, see Tenant resource groups. For information about tenant report classes, see Tenant report classes. Define classification rules to categorize work into service classes and the new tenant report class.
You begin by creating a tenant resource group with the z/OSMF Workload Management task.
Click Close to return to the table of steps, and complete the substeps for this step.

step.name: ObtainSolutionID
step.title: Obtain the solution ID
step.description: Obtain the solution ID that is required for the tenant resource group.
step.instructions:
The solution ID that was provided by IBM is required to create a tenant resource group in the next substep. The solution ID is available on the License Management Support (LMS) web portal.
  1. Sign in to the LMS web portal: LMS (www.ibm.com/software/lms/OpenServlet.wss)
  2. Click Container Pricing Solutions. Your solutions, along with the solution IDs, are displayed.
  3. If someone else will be creating the tenant resource group, provide that person with the appropriate solution ID, for example, by copying and pasting it from LMS into an email.

step.name: CreateTRGLeaf
step.title: Define the tenant resource group
step.description: Define the tenant resource group in z/OSMF Workload Management. Tenant resource groups support mapping workloads directly to Container Pricing for IBM Z.
step.instructions:
Before you begin

You will be working with the z/OSMF Workload Management task. You might want to open it in another browser window so that you can see this workflow and the Workload Management task at the same time. You can cut and paste the information from the address bar in the current browser window into the new browser window, so that you will be immediately logged into z/OSMF there.

Summary

Create a tenant resource group, specifying values as needed, including the 64-character Solution ID that was provided by IBM.

Details

To create a tenant resource group using the z/OSMF Workload Management task:
  1. Expand the Performance category in the navigation area, then select Workload Management. The Overview tab of Workload Management is displayed.
  2. Click Service Definitions. The Service Definitions page is displayed.
  3. Select the service definition that you want to work with, by clicking the checkbox before its name.
  4. Click Actions, then click Modify Service Definition, then Tenant Resource Groups. The Tenant Resource Groups table is displayed.
  5. To create a tenant resource group, click Actions, then select New. A table for creating a new tenant resource group is displayed.
  6. Supply the values for the tenant resource group that you want to create. Double-click in a field to make it editable. For complete information on the fields, click the Help link above the table, near Switch To.
    • Name: Name of the tenant resource group, unique and up to 8 characters.
    • Description: Optional, up to 32 characters.
    • Tenant ID: ID of the tenant, up to 8 characters.
    • Tenant name: Name of the tenant, up to 8 characters.
    • Solution ID: Solution ID that was provided by IBM, 64-characters. You should be able to copy and paste it directly from LMS, or, if another person has the responsibility for using LMS, you might cut and paste from communication, such as an email, from that person.
    • Type: Optional, use with the Capacity Maximum field to specify capping.
  7. Click Apply at the bottom of the page to save your work but continue with the service definition. This keeps you on the Tenant Report Groups table.
  8. Ensure that the tenant resource group was created, that is, no error messages are displayed. If there are any error messages, correct them before continuing.

step.name: CreateTRC
step.title: Create a tenant report class
step.description:
Create a tenant report class that is associated with the new tenant report group, using the z/OSMF Workload Management task. A tenant report class allows the ability to map workloads directly to Container Pricing for IBM Z.

For information about tenant report classes, see Tenant report classes.
step.instructions:
Summary

Create a tenant report class, specifying values as needed, including the tenant resource group that you created.

Details

To create a tenant report class that is associated with the tenant report group using the z/OSMF Workload Management task:
  1. On the tenant resource group page, click Switch To, then select Tenant Report Classes. Switch To is above the Tenant Report Groups table on the right side of the page.

    If you already left the Tenant Resource Group page, from the Service Definitions page, select the service definition that you want to work with, by clicking the checkbox before its name. Click Actions, then click Modify Service Definition, then Tenant Report Classes.

  2. To create a tenant report class, click Actions, then select New. A table for creating a new tenant report class is displayed.
  3. Supply the values for the tenant report class that you want to create. Double-click in a field to make it editable.
    • Name: Name of the tenant report class, unique and up to 8 characters.
    • Tenant Resource Group: Select the tenant resource group that you created.
    • Description: Optional, up to 32 characters.

    For complete information on the fields, click the Help link above the table.

  4. Click Apply at the bottom of the page.
  5. Ensure that the tenant report class was created and that no error messages are displayed. If there are any error messages, correct them before continuing.

step.name: DefineServiceClass
step.title: Define a service class
step.description:
A service class is a named group of work within a workload with similar performance characteristics.

For information about service classes, see Service classes.

The instructions include an example, which is continued in subsequent steps.
step.instructions:
Summary

Define a service class for use with the new container. You might begin by examining the service classes in your existing WLM service policy. If an existing service class meets the SLA requirements of the new container, you can use it in the next step in defining the classification rules. Otherwise, create a service class.

Details

This section includes the steps for creating a new service class as well as an example of the values you might specify when creating a service class. This example is continued in the next step.
Steps for creating a new service classExample
When creating a new service class, you might begin by identifying an existing service class for a group of work with similar performance characteristics, and use that as a model. To create the new service class using the z/OSMF Workload Management task:
  1. Click Switch To, then select Service Classes. Switch To is above the table on the right side of the page. The Service Classes page is displayed.

  2. In the table, click Actions, then select New Service Class. A table for creating a new service class is displayed.

    3. Supply the values for the service class that you want to create, including the workload. Double-click in a field to make it editable. For information on the fields, click the Help link above the table, near Switch To.

    If you create a new service class, verify that the service class is created (that is, no errors are displayed, and z/OSMF allows you to switch to another tab).

 Create a service class for the DB2 CRC Replication server based on the JES workload. Include performance goals, resource requirements, and business importance. Specify these values:

Name: DB2CRCS
CPU Critical: NO
I/O Priority Group: Normal
Honor Priority: Default
Workload: DB2_WLD
Description: DB2 CRC Replication Server
Importance: 2
Goal type: Velocity
Velocity Goal: 40

step.name: CreateClassificationRules
step.title: Define classification rules for the workload
step.description:
Define classification rules for the address spaces and started tasks in the workload. Classification rules categorize work into service classes, and report classes or tenant report classes, based on WLM subsystem type and work qualifiers.

The available work qualifiers depend on the subsystem. For more information, see Classification rules.
step.instructions:
Summary

Define classification rules for the solution work, specifying the tenant report class that you created. The tenant report class is associated with the tenant report group, which maps the workload to Container Pricing for IBM Z.

Details

This section includes the steps for defining classification rules, as well as an example of values that you might specify. The example is continued from the previous step.
Steps for classificationExample (continued)

To define classification rules for the workload using the z/OSMF Workload Management task:

  1. Click Switch To, then select Classifications.
  2. To modify a classification, select it in the classifications table, then click Actions, then select Properties.

    To define a new classification, in the classifications table, click Actions, then select New. A page for creating a classification is displayed.

    Then, specify the appropriate values.

    • Subsystem type: Subsystem type, for example, DB2.
    • Service class: Service class that you defined for use with the container.
    • Report class: Tenant report class that you created.

    Classification Rules

    To create a new classification rule, click Actions, then select New Level 1 Rule.

    Classification rules are organized in a nested hierarchy. The top level or container is the subsystem type or classification. You can define up to four levels of nesting within the classification. To do so, add rules to the Classification Rules table. The order in which z/OS® Workload Manager (WLM) searches the rules is determined by the order in which you specify the rules. You can use a different hierarchy for each subsystem type. When a subsystem receives a work request, WLM uses the work qualifiers to sequentially check for a match against each level one rule defined within the classification. When it finds a match, it continues through the level two rules nested within the matching level one rule until it finds a match. WLM continues searching the levels and the sub-rules of the matching levels until the last matching rule is found. The last matching rule determines the service class and report class to be assigned.

    For more information on defining classification rules with the z/OSMF Workload Management task, click Help above Switch To on the Properties for Classification page.

    For more information about classification rules, see Classification rules.

  3. When you are finished, click OK at the bottom of the page.
  4. Ensure that the classification rules were created and that no error messages are displayed. If there are any error messages, correct them before continuing.

Specify these values for classification.
Subsystem type: DB2
Service class: DB2CRCS
Report class: DB2TRC (the name of the tenant report class)

step.name: InstallActivate
step.title: Install and activate the service definition
step.description: Install the service definition into the WLM couple data set for the sysplex and activate a service policy.
step.instructions:
To install the service definition into the WLM couple data set and activate the service policy:
  1. Click the Service Definitions tab. You may have several tabs showing on the Workload Management page.
  2. In the service definitions table, select the service definition you want to install and activate, by clicking the checkbox next to the name.
  3. Click Actions, then click Install and Activate.

step.name: GenerateSCRTReport
step.title: Prepare to generate an SCRT report
step.description:
After your container pricing solution is implemented in the colocated LPAR configuration and the workload runs, you update your Sub Capacity Reporting Tool (SCRT) configuration. After the update, SCRT uses the container pricing data to understand the resource consumption, and it removes the container’s MSU consumption from the LPAR’s rolling four-hour average (R4HA). This change is reflected in your next monthly SCRT usage report.

Click Close to return to the table of steps, and complete the substeps for this step.

step.name: ObtainSCRTCommand
step.title: Obtain the container solution information from LMS
step.description: Obtain the container solution information that will be used to update the SCRT configuration.
step.instructions:
1. Sign in to the LMS web portal: LMS (www-304.ibm.com/software/lms/index.wss).
  2. Click Container Pricing Solutions to display the list of approved solutions.
  3. Find the solution. The information for the solution includes an UPDATE CONTAINER command that updates the SCRT configuration. It sets the solution name, which is associated with the container through the specified solution ID.
  4. If someone else will be updating the SCRT configuration, provide that person with the container solution information, for example, by copying and pasting it from LMS into an email.

step.name: UpdateSCRTConfiguration
step.title: Update your SCRT configuration
step.instructions: Open your SCRT JCL, find the SPECIAL DD statement, and update it with the command that was obtained from LMS. You might copy and paste the command directly from LMS, or, if another person has the responsibility for using LMS, from communication such as an email from that person.

step.name: SubmitUsageReport
step.title: Submit the usage report to IBM
step.description: Submit the next SCRT usage report to IBM.
step.instructions:
Submit the next SCRT usage report through LMS.
  1. Login to the LMS web portal: LMS (www.ibm.com/software/lms/OpenServlet.wss).
  2. Submit the report that was generated by SCRT.
